title: Microsoft Edge: A Frustrating and Glitchy Experience**
text: Microsoft Edge aims to be a sleek, secure browser, but in reality, it often feels like an obstacle rather than an asset. Its usability issues, lack of compatibility, and frustrating authentication process make it difficult to recommend.  ### **Password Creation Issues**  Signing into a new app and creating a password should be simple, but Edge unnecessarily complicates the process. The forced reliance on Microsoft Authenticator—especially with its impending retirement—makes this even worse. Users shouldn’t have to jump through extra hoops just to access their accounts.  ### **Glitches & Site Incompatibilities**  Edge’s struggles extend beyond just logins. Websites like **Synapse Mobility** and **Religipax** frequently fail to load or function correctly, forcing users to troubleshoot or switch browsers entirely. Whether it's rendering problems, slow response times, or broken features, Edge feels unreliable for anything beyond casual browsing.  ### **Overall Verdict**  Rather than delivering efficiency and convenience, Microsoft Edge often feels like a frustrating puzzle that users must constantly solve. With so many alternative browsers offering smoother performance and better compatibility, it’s hard to justify sticking with Edge unless forced by workplace requirements. Until Microsoft addresses these persistent issues, Edge remains more of a liability than a useful tool.

title: ‏Suggestion for Enhancing the Review System on the Microsoft Store
text: Dear Microsoft Support Team,I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to propose an enhancement to the user experience on the Microsoft Store for PC applications.Currently, many users face challenges in fully expressing their opinions when writing reviews for applications and software. The limited space allocated for text input often restricts users from conveying their thoughts comprehensively.I suggest increasing the character limit for the review text field, allowing users to provide more detailed and informative feedback. This improvement would not only enhance the quality of information available to other users but also assist them in making more informed decisions when selecting applications.Thank you for considering this suggestion. I look forward to seeing future improvements in the Microsoft Store.Best regards,

title: Lack of Support
text: I have been confronting some issues for which I have asked for help to no avail. Before I would get the assistance needed within a couple of days but now I don’t get any type of response nor assistance from Microsoft.On 5/07/25 & 5/09/25 I wrote to Microsoft Edge AI Browser Support asking for help in reference to an issue that I was confronting with my email folders which had began after a recent update. Once I created a new folder these were not getting into their corresponding alphabetical order as they were supposed to but remained at the top of the folders list. Since I did not receive any response to my inquiry I wrote a two Stars Review about the malfunctioning of Edge AI Browser on the Apple Store and about their lack of support since this wasn’t the first time my inquiries were ignored.On May 13, I got a response from Apple letting me know that Microsoft Edge AI Browser Developer had responded to my two stars review. They apologized for my bad experience and asked for details about the issue that I was confronting. I provided them the required information and also provided them a couple of pictures showing exactly what was the issue that I was referring to.On May 14, 2025 @ 2:18 am Edge AI Browser Support wrote asking me for some more information since they allegedly weren’t sure what was the whole issue about. At 8:35 am I responded to their email providing more information about the issue and even sent them two additional more photos. At approx. 11:30 am I wrote an other email letting them know that I had been able to solve the issue on my own hence I didn’t need any assistance from them.

title: Good, but needs PDF
text: I’ve appreciated the Edge browser for awhile, especially because of superior ad-blocking built in. However, it no longer supports printing to PDF and now only creates proprietary files that can’t be shared outside the Microsoft ecosystem. That’s a tremendous limit on accessibility, and is completely unrealistic as an iPhone user. Also, there should be options for custom search engines (in order to opt out of Google AI tools).

title: Good browser, but buggy update
text: Generally speaking, I’d usually give this app 5/5 stars. Useful for people who need that MS account integration. However sometime in this past week, I started experiencing a bug that causes this browser to crash within seconds of opening it. I’ve attempted force touching the app icon for the context menu, hoping I could open a normal tab or a InPrivate tab in a feeble attempt to bypass this near immediate crash. No luck. May be fixable by uninstalling and reinstalling, but I’ve been holding out for a bug fix update.I don’t know specifically which update this began on, but I’ve updated at least twice since it started. Using latest iOS for my supported device, so not sure what the deal is.It’s usually a great browser. I’ve used it for well over a year with no issues. Still recommended, I just hope this issue gets ironed out.

title: Good in its current form
text: I am looking for a mobile browser that will give me the best possible desktop website format possible, including websites with embedded videos & Youtube. So far, this browser allows me to set my preference to desktop view for all websites. Full screen is an issue at times but playback and interactivity is consistently functional. My passwords are remembered throughout my visited websites even when I switch back & forth from mobile to desktop format. No odd glitches. In its current iteration, this is the best, least glitchy, and most practically customizable mobile browser.

title: 光文稿与数据占用几个G，这是浏览器啊？！
text: 自从edge改用chromium内核以后，就越来越臃肿了，资讯源乱七八糟的新闻越来越向国产浏览器看齐了，果然是“入乡随俗”。之前的老iPhone8p一直保留着44.10.19版本没更新，用了这么多年，软件本体加文稿数据一共才204M。现在iPhone15pro用的123.0.2420.74版本，单单文稿与数据就占用2.12G，并且还会随着使用逐渐变大，浏览器内还没有清除缓存的选项，想要清理只能卸载软件重新安装，但是就自动更新了新版本（就得忍受新版本各种bug），属于是强买强卖。本来简洁清爽的edge，如今也变成臃肿油腻的模样了。微软，你也想学国内厂商把浏览器做成“3A大作”吗？！
Allah Akbar سبحان الله
